data.title: St. Louis Blues
data.meta_description: News about the St. Louis Blues, including commentary and archival articles published in The New York Times.
data.text:
N.H.L. Playoff PREVIEW

Avalanche Are Cup Favorites, but Even the Islanders Can Dream

The playoffs open on Saturday with Game 1 between the Capitals and Bruins, one of the eight first-round matchups. Things look a little different this year.

By Andrew Knoll

The 2021 N.H.L. Playoffs Are Underway

We answer your playoff hockey questions: When they start, who plays who, how you can watch, and what is all the fuss about the Stanley Cup.

By Victor Mather

N.H.L.’s Rising Stars Power Chicago and Minnesota

The first-year goaltender Kevin Lankinen has helped Chicago to playoff position, and the Wild’s Kirill Kaprizov is leading all rookies in scoring.

By Andrew Knoll

Professional Hockey Is Disrupted by Coronavirus

The N.H.L. had its ninth postponement of the season on Thursday, and one of the six teams in the National Women’s Hockey League had to leave its two-week season early.

By Seth Berkman

The First Round of the N.H.L. Playoffs Is Set. There Have Already Been Upsets.

The top seeds in the Western and Eastern play-in tournaments were eliminated, and the No. 1 teams in the round robin slid to fourth as the first round is set to begin Tuesday.

By Andrew Knoll

When a Teammate Collapsed, the St. Louis Blues Reeled. Then They Rallied.

The team returns to Anaheim on Wednesday for the first time since defenseman Jay Bouwmeester had a cardiac episode during a game there in February.

By Allan Kreda

N.H.L. Takeaways at the Season’s Midpoint

At the halfway mark of the season, five head coaches have been fired, and the St. Louis Blues are thriving as the reigning champions.

By Andrew Knoll

Postscript

Done Singing for the Blues, He Happily Wears Their Stanley Cup Ring

Multiple sclerosis forced Charles Glenn to step aside as the St. Louis Blues’ anthem singer just as they were winning their first championship. He has both moved on and held on.

By Ben Shpigel

Takeaways From the First Month of the N.H.L. Season

The season already has its share of surprises, even if the past four weeks might not say much about how it all ends.

By Andrew Knoll and Allan Kreda
